caption.title: The spatial relationship between temperature and vegetation cover.
caption.p: Spatial relationship between the summer warmth index (SWI 5, °C) and the annual maximum fraction of absorbed photosynthetically active radiation ( F max, %), for the three-year period from 1982–1984. The 95th percentile of the distribution of F max ( F 95) in each 5°C bin represents the maximum attainable F max for a given annual SWI 5 (black dashed line). A breakpoint regression applied to the 95th percentile approximates the sensitivity of F max to spatial changes in SWI5 (red dashed line), and delineates regions where F max is temperature limited and those that are not, as either below or above the breakpoint (vertical dashed line).
